Hi, I’m Phat Nguyen. üëã # I am a DevOps Engineer, passionate about building scalable cloud infrastructure, ensuring security, and automating the boring stuff. Check out my full professional history in my Resume.
Why this blog? # I believe the best way to master a concept is to explain it to someone else.
In the DevOps world, tools evolve rapidly‚Äîtoday it’s Jenkins, tomorrow GitHub Actions; today EC2, tomorrow Serverless. This blog serves as my digital garden and documentation hub.
Here, I share:
Practical guides on AWS, Kubernetes, and IaC. Troubleshooting logs for specific errors I‚Äôve spent hours debugging (so you don’t have to). Deep dives into Linux internals and Security best practices. My goal isn’t just to show how to do something, but to explore why we do it that way.
My Tech Philosophy # I am a strong advocate for Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and Immutable Infrastructure.
“If you have to SSH into a server to fix it, something has gone wrong in the pipeline.”
My daily toolkit includes:
AWS Google CloudGCP TerraformTerraform TerraformTerragrunt AnsibleAnsible GoGo PythonPython GNU BashBash DatadogDatadog PrometheusPrometheus GrafanaGrafana Beyond the Terminal # When I’m not writing YAML or optimizing pipelines, I step away from the screen. I enjoy reading books and playing with kettlebells. It keeps my mind fresh for the next debugging session.
Let’s Connect # I am always open to discussing Cloud architecture, new tech stacks, or just chatting about the latest industry trends.
